title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) – On a night when offense was a precious commodity, one man authored a masterpiece. With the game hanging in the balance, Hakeem Olajuwon did not just carry the Houston Rockets; he placed them squarely on his legendary shoulders and delivered a performance for the ages, powering a 101-90 road victory over the Milwaukee Bucks.

In an era of defensive grit, Olajuwon was an unstoppable force of nature. The Milwaukee defense had no answer for "The Dream," who poured in a colossal 44 points on a night where no other player cracked 30. His scoring outburst was a study in dominance, a blend of graceful footwork and powerful finishes that left the Bucks grasping at air.

While Olajuwon’s scoring was historic, his all-around brilliance sealed the win. He controlled the glass with 16 rebounds, anchored the defense with 3 blocks, and even dished out 3 assists, proving to be the complete and utter focal point of the Rockets’ attack. Clyde Drexler provided crucial support with 20 points, but this was unequivocally Olajuwon’s showcase.

The Bucks, led by Ray Allen’s 22 points, fought valiantly but were simply overmatched by a singular force operating at his peak. Every time Milwaukee threatened to close the gap, Olajuwon had an answer—a silky turnaround jumper, a powerful post move, or a commanding defensive stop. It was a virtuoso performance, a reminder that on any given night, a legend can transcend the game and single-handedly will his team to victory. The final score tells the story of a team win, but the history books will remember it as the night Hakeem Olajuwon was simply perfect.
